TENSION.Definition: a situation of fear or anger between two groups

NUCLEAR HOLOCAUST.Definition: a possible nearly complete destruction of human civilisation by nuclear war

TENSE.Definition: showing or causing worry and nervousness

STANDOFF.Definition: a situation in which neither side was winning the competition

BALLISTIC.Definition: shot or thrown through the air

GATHERED HIS THOUGHTS.Definition: thought about what he was going to do

TURNED OUT.Definition: came to light, proved to be the case

MALFUNCTIONED.Definition: failed to work correctly or normally

CONVINCINGLY.Definition: in a way that causes someone to believe that it was true

OUTPOST.Definition: a remote part of the country

FOLLOWED IN HIS FATHER’S FOOTSTEPS.Definition: did what his father had done

MALFUNCTION.Definition: fail to work correctly or normally

FATEFUL.Definition: having a very important effect on the future

LEAD UP.Definition: the events that led to that point

ALLIANCE.Definition: a group of countries that worked together during the war

PROPAGANDA.Definition: information planned to affect people's opinions

OUTSIDER.Definition: someone that didn't belong to their special group

DISTRUST.Definition: the feeling of not trusting one another

CONTAINMENT.Definition: the act of preventing or limiting a country's expansion or growth

STOCKPILING.Definition: collecting and storing in large amounts

PARANOID.Definition: extremely worried or nervous because they believed they were in danger

VAPORISED.Definition: destroyed by turning it into gas or vapour

PARANOIA.Definition: an unreasonable feeling that the other side was going to harm them

NUCLEAR HOLOCAUSTS.Definition: events of complete destruction of human civilisation by nuclear war

SUPREMACY.Definition: the state of being better than others

IDEOLOGIES.Definition: set of beliefs, standards or principles, especially in politics

RELUCTANTLY.Definition: in a way that showed that they didn't particularly want to do it

DETECTION.Definition: the act of noticing or identifying

STARING.Definition: looking directly and in fixed way

INTERCOM.Definition: a device that allowed them to communicate within the building

REWARD.Definition: something given in exchange for his correct decision

MEMOIR.Definition: a piece of writing containing his personal experiences

REWARDED.Definition: gave anything in exchange for his correct decision

SUBURB.Definition: an area on the edge of the city
